001/**
002 * This class fetches the employee information from the database
003 * @author Isha Virk
004 */
005package src.data;
006
007import src.database.db_connect;
008import src.model.employee;
009
010import java.sql.*;
011import java.util.ArrayList;
012import java.util.Collections;
013import java.util.List;
014
015/**
016 * This class fetches the employee information from the database
017 */
018public class employee_data {
019    private static final String TABLE = "public.employee";
020
021    /**
022     * This function creates the SQL query to get all the employee data from the database
023     * @return - returns the SQL query
024     */
025    public static List<employee> getAll() {
026        final String sql =
027            "SELECT employeename, position, salary, reporting " + "FROM " + TABLE + " ORDER BY employeename";
028        return query(sql);
029    }
030
031    /**
032     * This function processes the query and converts the information to a list
033     * @param sql - the SQL query
034     * @param params - A string array of the query parameters
035     * @return - returns the list format of the employee information
036     */
037    private static List<employee> query(String sql, String... params) {
038        List<employee> list = new ArrayList<>();
039        try (Connection conn = db_connect.getConnection();
040             PreparedStatement ps = conn.prepareStatement(sql)) {
041
042            for (int i = 0; i < params.length; i++) {
043                ps.setString(i + 1, params[i]);
044            }
045
046            try (ResultSet rs = ps.executeQuery()) {
047                while (rs.next()) {
048                    list.add(fromRow(rs));
049                }
050            }
051        } catch (Exception e) {
052            e.printStackTrace();
053            return Collections.emptyList();
054        }
055        return list;
056    }
057
058    /**
059     * This function creates an employee object for each employee and their respective info found in the list
060     * @param rs - The result from the SQL query
061     * @return - returns the employee object created from the information from the database
062     * @throws SQLException - Throws a SQL exception if the query cannot be processed
063     */
064    private static employee fromRow(ResultSet rs) throws SQLException {
065        String name      = rs.getString("employeename");
066        String position  = rs.getString("position");
067        float  salary    = rs.getFloat("salary");      // use getDouble if you change the model
068        String reporting = rs.getString("reporting");
069        return new employee(name, position, salary, reporting);
070    }
071}
